cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles (90 km) south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across Cuba tonight and Monday, then turning northwest over the southeastern and central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near the Louisiana/Texas border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Ocean Reef to Key West and Dry Tortugas, Florida Bay, the central Bahamas and Andros Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for much of Cuba, Haiti, northern Dominican Republic coast, Turks & Caicos and the southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Florida Keys, south-central and western Cuba, then Gulf Coast from Texas to western Alabama later in the week
weather_observation.wind: Occasional rain-band gusts could approach tropical-storm strength, but sustained gale-force winds are unlikely (≤4% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida coast given current track well south and west of PortMiami.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands Monday could bring 1–3 inches of rain with brief localized street flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased seas, high surf and dangerous rip currents Monday–Tuesday could affect harbor pilotage and small-craft operations.
